result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan D Wieczorek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders in lieu of paying the costs, defendant to serve 11 days Jail.  Sentence credit for 11 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.
Straight time.   Sentence credit for 60 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nathan D Wieczorek in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #3.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #3.  Count #4 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #3.  
Sentence of:
60 Days Jail.  (Credit - 60 days).  TIME SERVED
COSTS:  $253.00 in lieu of paying the costs, Defendant to serve 11 days jail, Credit 11 days.  TIME SERVED.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
